## Лабораторна робота № 1
1. 
```r
> mat <- matrix(rnorm(50), ncol=5, nrow = 10)
> mat
            [,1]       [,2]        [,3]        [,4]       [,5]
 [1,]  0.4649359  0.3084776 -0.33568587 -0.50422837 -0.6309283
 [2,] -2.5074038  1.5369888  0.35704766  1.85066530  0.4671598
 [3,]  0.6821339  0.5961055  0.75094157 -1.37619481 -1.8130150
 [4,]  0.0173863  0.2015420 -0.85745735  0.11235915 -1.5697417
 [5,] -0.1510274  0.6343630  0.64248531  0.91740982  1.3421089
 [6,] -0.1472028 -1.2608450 -1.08814981 -0.83630216  0.3599594
 [7,] -0.9000114 -0.2250627  0.04435672 -1.21211059  1.0444148
 [8,] -0.4389685 -1.6047036  0.24788794  0.70325862 -1.4364318
 [9,]  0.8248451  0.5754544 -0.22798352  0.03076622  0.9321139
[10,]  2.5097026  0.5548392 -0.01836141  1.12555398 -0.8088838
```
2.
```r
> apply(mat, 2, max)
[1] 2.5097026 1.5369888 0.7509416 1.8506653 1.3421089
```
3.
```r
> apply(mat, 2, mean)
[1]  0.03543898  0.13171591 -0.04849187  0.08111772 -0.21132438
```
4.
```r
> apply(mat, 1, min)
 [1] -0.6309283 -2.5074038 -1.8130150 -1.5697417 -0.1510274 -1.2608450 -1.2121106 -1.6047036 -0.2279835 -0.8088838
```
5.
```r
> apply(mat, 2, sort)
            [,1]       [,2]        [,3]        [,4]       [,5]
 [1,] -2.5074038 -1.6047036 -1.08814981 -1.37619481 -1.8130150
 [2,] -0.9000114 -1.2608450 -0.85745735 -1.21211059 -1.5697417
 [3,] -0.4389685 -0.2250627 -0.33568587 -0.83630216 -1.4364318
 [4,] -0.1510274  0.2015420 -0.22798352 -0.50422837 -0.8088838
 [5,] -0.1472028  0.3084776 -0.01836141  0.03076622 -0.6309283
 [6,]  0.0173863  0.5548392  0.04435672  0.11235915  0.3599594
 [7,]  0.4649359  0.5754544  0.24788794  0.70325862  0.4671598
 [8,]  0.6821339  0.5961055  0.35704766  0.91740982  0.9321139
 [9,]  0.8248451  0.6343630  0.64248531  1.12555398  1.0444148
[10,]  2.5097026  1.5369888  0.75094157  1.85066530  1.3421089
```
6.
```r
> apply(mat, 2, function(x) length(x[x<0]))
[1] 5 3 5 4 5
```
7.
```r
> apply(mat, 2, function(x) if(length(x[x>2])>=1) TRUE else FALSE)
[1]  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE
```
